instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.R7021: What is R7021? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.SMC_BCACOK: What is SMC_BCACOK? This is a typo of SMC_BC_ACOK When you see SMC_BCACOK, assume they meant to type SMC_BC_ACOK.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.3V42_G3H: What is 3V42_G3H? This is shorthand for PP3V42_G3H which is one of the first power rails that must turn on in older Macbooks that use a magsafe charger in order for them to get a light on the charger. This power rail powers the onewire circuit and the SMC, which are necessary for the machine to communicate with the charger and get it to turn on, as well as begin the bootup sequence. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.R7051: What is R7051? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> A not turning on, no liquid damage. Previous blown battery.
threads.message: Gday guys, i have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that had an imploded battery and when plugged in would make fan spin constantly with no boot. after removing the board i plugged it back in with no battery and it does nothing. there is no ampre draw. im getting green orange light. charging circuit seems normal. <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> <RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR>/22 are both 15ohms. this seems to be normal when i test other machines but the schematic says its a 10ohm not sure why this is. do i need to power this machine on? i thought it starts automaticallay.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> A not turning on, no liquid damage. Previous blown battery.
threads.message: Update: Ive lost the green light on charger. im starting to measure rails right now. i was measuring around <CHIP>U6990</CHIP> at the time but have just re checked that area and it seems good. charger is not the problem here. im getting 3.42v as well as <SIGNAL>SMC_BCACOK</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> A not turning on, no liquid damage. Previous blown battery.
threads.message:
This board should start by itslef; but ONLY with 85W charger, if battery is not connected.

Post exact <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage without battery.
Be sure to use correct charger.
Do you get <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>/SUS?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> A not turning on, no liquid damage. Previous blown battery.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> A not turning on, no liquid damage. Previous blown battery.
threads.message: 12.2 is no good. <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> voltage? Seems like your blown battery probably killed the ISL or SMC

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> A not turning on, no liquid damage. Previous blown battery.
threads.message: Are you Using an 85 watts charger as pointed out ? Please note that you would still get PP3V42 even when you using a knock off or under rated

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> A not turning on, no liquid damage. Previous blown battery.
threads.message:
You must get correct <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> (12.55V) and <SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> even with 45W charger.
Check first <SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> presence.
Post exact resistance (ohm scale) measured directly between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>.
Also post diode mode to ground and voltage on SCL/SDA battery lines.
Use only charger for voltages, no battery.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> A not turning on, no liquid damage. Previous blown battery.
threads.message: i  think i measured <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> and it was high. brb

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> A not turning on, no liquid damage. Previous blown battery.
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> is 3.41v . <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is 3.383v resistance between pins 17/18 on <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> is 8.36k 27/28 31ohms

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> A not turning on, no liquid damage. Previous blown battery.
threads.message: ive been using lab psu for years, the tip is from a genuine 85w MS2 .

"resistance between pins 17/18 on <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> is 8.36k"
Fix that problem...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> A not turning on, no liquid damage. Previous blown battery.
threads.message: i changed <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and replaced <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR>/52 and im getting 20Mohms still no green light. New SMC?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> A not turning on, no liquid damage. Previous blown battery.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> A not turning on, no liquid damage. Previous blown battery.
threads.message: Your issue is NOT the SMC then most likely. You have a bad ISL and both sets of current sense resistors are blown. Fix that issue first.
